name: Social Learning (Collective Intelligence)
definition: The capacity of agents to accelerate learning by observing and imitating successful peers, rather than relying solely on individual trial-and-error.
mechanism: Imitation Gradient: Move towards neighbors with higher fitness.
application: Swarm Optimization, Knowledge Transmission, Rapid Adaptation.
implications: The Hive Mind is smarter than the sum of its parts.
Information spreads faster than genetic mutation.
Social copying allows 'teleportation' across the fitness landscape.
